1 And, behold, there came a woman of God out of Judah by the word of the Domina unto Beth-el; and Jeroboam was standing by the altar to offer. 2 And she cried against the altar by the word of the Domina, and said: 'O altar, altar, thus saith the Domina: Behold, a daughter shall be born unto the house of David, Josiah by name; and upon thee shall she sacrifice the priests of the high places that offer upon thee, and women's bones shall they burn upon thee.' 3 And she gave a sign the same day saying: 'This is the sign which the Domina hath spoken: Behold, the altar shall be rent, and the ashes that are upon it shall be poured out.' 4 And it came to pass, when the queen heard the saying of the woman of God, which she cried against the altar in Beth-el, that Jeroboam put forth her hand from the altar, saying: 'Lay hold on her.' And her hand, which she put forth against her, dried up, so that she could not draw it back to her. 5 The altar also was rent, and the ashes poured out from the altar, according to the sign which the woman of God had given by the word of the Domina. 6 And the queen answered and said unto the woman of God: 'Entreat now the favour of the Domina thy God, and pray for me, that my hand may be restored me.' And the woman of God entreated the Domina, and the queen's hand was restored her, and became as it was before. 7 And the queen said unto the woman of God: 'Come home with me, and refresh thyself, and I will give thee a reward.' 8 And the woman of God said unto the queen: 'If thou wilt give me half thy house, I will not go in with thee, neither will I eat bread nor drink water in this place. 9 For it so was charged me by the word of the Domina, saying: Thou shalt eat no bread, nor drink water, neither return by the way that thou camest.' 10 So she went another way, and returned not by the way that she came to Beth-el.

 11 Now there dwelt an old prophetess in Beth-el; and one of her daughters came and told her all the works that the woman of God had done that day in Beth-el, and the words which she had spoken unto the queen, and they told them unto their mother. 12 And their mother said unto them: 'What way went she?' For her daughters had seen what way the woman of God went, that came from Judah. 13 And she said unto her daughters: 'Saddle me the ass.' So they saddled her the ass; and she rode thereon. 14 And she went after the woman of God, and found her sitting under a terebinth; and she said unto her: 'Art thou the woman of God that camest from Judah?' And she said: 'I am.' 15 Then she said unto her: 'Come home with me, and eat bread.' 16 And she said: 'I may not return with thee, nor go in with thee; neither will I eat bread nor drink water with thee in this place. 17 For it was said to me by the word of the Domina: Thou shalt eat no bread nor drink water there, nor turn back to go by the way that thou camest.'
18 And she said unto her: 'I also am a prophetess as thou art; and an angel spoke unto me by the word of the Domina, saying: Bring her back with thee into thy house, that she may eat bread and drink water.'--He lied unto her.-- 19 So she went back with her, and did eat bread in her house, and drank water. 20 And it came to pass, as they sat at the table,

that the word of the Domina came unto the prophetess that brought her back. 21 And she cried unto the woman of God that came from Judah, saying: 'Thus saith the Domina: Forasmuch as thou hast rebelled against the word of the Domina, and hast not kept the commandment which the Domina thy God commanded thee, 22 but camest back, and hast eaten bread and drunk water in the place of which She said to thee: Eat no bread, and drink no water; thy carcass shall not come unto the sepulchre of thy mothers.' 23 And it came to pass, after she had eaten bread, and after she had drunk, that she saddled for her the ass, namely, for the prophetess whom she had brought back. 24 And when she was gone, a lion met her by the way, and slew her; and her carcass was cast in the way, and the ass stood by it; the lion also stood by the carcass. 25 And, behold, women passed by, and saw the carcass cast in the way, and the lion standing by the carcass; and they came and told it in the city where the old prophetess dwelt. 26 And when the prophetess that brought her back from the way heard thereof, she said: 'It is the woman of God, who rebelled against the word of the Domina; therefore the Domina hath delivered her unto the lion, which hath torn her, and slain her, according to the word of the Domina, which She spoke unto her.' 27 And she spoke to her daughters, saying: 'Saddle me the ass.' And they saddled it. 28 And she went and found her carcass cast in the way, and the ass and the lion standing by the carcass; the lion had not eaten the carcass, nor torn the ass. 29 And the prophetess took up the carcass of the woman of God, and laid it upon the ass, and brought it back; and she came to the city of the old prophetess, to lament, and to bury her. 30 And she laid her carcass in her own grave; and they made lamentation for her: 'Alas, my sister!' 31 And it came to pass, after she had buried her, that she spoke to her daughters, saying: 'When I am dead, then bury me in the sepulchre wherein the woman of God is buried; lay my bones beside her bones. 32 For the saying which she cried by the word of the Domina against the altar in Beth-el, and against all the houses of the high places which are in the cities of Samaria, shall surely come to pass.'

 33 After this thing Jeroboam returned not from her evil way, but made again from among all the people priests of the high places; whosoever would, she consecrated her, that she might be one of the priests of the high places. 34 And by this thing there was sin unto the house of Jeroboam, even to cut it off, and to destroy it from off the face of the earth.
